cs113.calendar.guiview
Class LoginComponent

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  cs113.calendar.guiview.LoginComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class LoginComponent
extends javax.swing.JPanel

Allows a user to graphically log in or logout using a simple set of text controls and buttons. Automatically updates to respond to application state (i.e. will always be in sync with the associated ViewState object). While external changes to the application state are supported, be wary of the state of the controller when changing the application state, as it must match the authentication state of the global application state for proper operation.

Author:
Michael Koval
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

LoginComponent

public LoginComponent(Controller ctrl,
                      ViewState state,
                      ViewState.State start)
Constructs a new LoginComponent that uses ctrl to authenticate login attempts against the Model. Users are notified of invalid login attempts by a small red error message below the text field.

Parameters:
ctrl - controller used to authenticate login attempts
state - wrapper around the global application state
start - state in which a newly logged-in user should begin
Method Detail

isLoggedIn

public boolean isLoggedIn()
Check whether the current user is logged in using the controller associated with this component.

Returns:
whether the current user is logged in.

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
Prevent the user from logging in via this control.

Overrides:
setEnabled in class javax.swing.JComponent

enterLoginState

private void enterLoginState()
Switch to the internal login state. This allows a user to enter his or her login information to authenticate his or herself. Despite the name of this method, this is called when the user logs out.

enterLogoutState

private void enterLogoutState()
Switch to the internal "logout" state. This allows an already-logged in user to logout, allowing the component to accept another user's login information. Despite the name of this method, it is called when the user logs in.

showError

private void showError()
Display an error message to notify the user of an invalid login attempt.

hideError

private void hideError()
Hide any error messages that may be currently displayed.
